meanings.definition: Not apportioned or distributed in a fair or equal manner.
meanings.sent1: The malapportioned resources led to unfair outcomes for some students.
meanings.sent2: The malapportioned candy distribution left some kids with more treats than others.
meanings.sent3: The malapportioned seating arrangement at the party caused confusion among guests.
meanings.sent4: Her malapportioned workload made it challenging to complete tasks efficiently.
meanings.sent5: The malapportioned puzzle pieces made it impossible to complete the picture.

meanings.definition: Unequally distributed or allocated, especially in terms of political representation.
meanings.sent1: The malapportioned voting districts resulted in unfair elections.
meanings.sent2: The malapportioned budget allocation favored certain regions over others.
meanings.sent3: The malapportioned team assignments caused chaos during the project.
meanings.sent4: His malapportioned influence in the group made decision-making difficult.
meanings.sent5: The malapportioned power dynamics within the organization created tension among members.
